paragraph.paragraph: The New Cluster Wizard allow you to add a new url*cluster to an EiffelEnvision project. For information on how to add url*clusters to projects, see adding_clusters.xmlAdding New Clusters.
The wizard is separated into two pages. Overview and Assertions. You may switch between the pages by clicking on the name of the page, located in the wizard's left pane.
The Overview page presents the most basic of any new url*Cluster Properties.

Name
This field should be unique within your project, and will be the name given to the cluster after it has been added to your project. The Name should adhere to the adding_cluster_guidelines.xmlcluster_namesAdding Cluster Guidelines. This is a required field and cannot be left blank or contain any illegal characters.

Namespace
An alternative cpconTheNETFrameworkClassLibrary 0 Namespace for the cluster, which will be used to full qualify the generated types in the assembly manifest after a ../../../compiling_projects/index.xmlcluster_namesBuild. This field is optional.

Path
The path that will be assigned to the cluster when added to the project.

Include Subdirectories
This option relates to the url*Include Subdirectories property of a url*Cluster Node. Selecting this option will include all subdirectories in the specified Path.

Library
This option relates to the url*Library property of a url*Cluster Node. Selecting this option will include all subdirectories in the specified Path.

Override
This option relates to the url*Override property of a url*Cluster Node. Selecting this option will ensure the clusters classes will be taken over any other project classes that have the same name.

The Assertions page contains a number of optional options related to finer grained control over how project's url*contracts are evaluated at runtime. Create a cluster and ignoring this page will use the ../project_configuration/assertions.xmlAssertion Properties set in the ../project_configuration/index.xmlProject Properties.

Discard Assertions When Optimizing
Set by default, having this option select will discard all assertion options when the ../project_configuration/build.xmloptimize_codeOptimize Code property, in the ../project_configuration/build.xmloptimize_codeBuild Project Properties, is set to Yes. The has the same effect as turning off all assertions (detailed below) for the cluster, when optimizing code.

Use Default Assertions
Set by default, having this option select will use the ../project_configuration/assertions.xmlAssertion Properties set in the ../project_configuration/index.xmlProject Properties.

Evaluate Preconditions
When set, preconditions will be evaluated at runtime for all classes in the created cluster.

Evaluate Postconditions
When set, postconditions will be evaluated at runtime for all classes in the created cluster.

Evaluate Checks
When set, checks will be evaluated at runtime for all classes in the created cluster.

Evaluate Loops
When set, loops will be evaluated at runtime for all classes in the created cluster.

Evaluate Invariants
When set, invariants will be evaluated at runtime for all classes in the created cluster.
Once you have set the appropriate settings for the new url*cluster, clicking Finish will add the cluster to the project.
